TopicTitle: [PLUGIN][ALPHA-10] City Lights and Clouds on Kerbin/Others

Articles.Content:
My idea was to add dots. Lots of dots, as looking at pictures from orbit, or even just from a look out spot near my home, you see lots of dots, such as lights from buildings.

But I'm not that satisfied with how it turned out. May try something similar another time.

But, have some screenshots, see what you think.

(Images linked to larger size.)

Too pixel-y? To bright? What you do reckon?

Yeah, and it is at a point that feels more solid to me, and does almost everything I initially wanted. Following you? hmmm... I can't think of why that might happen.

Another thing I noticed, is that when you zoom in from IVA view, is the lights and clouds don't zoom with the planet, giving a disconcerting effect. Could be related. But I'm still using the previous version, will update later.

You aren't the first to mention issues with IVA... I tried it out yesterday with Beta-1 and couldn't see any problems, so I'll have to look at it again in more depth.

I really like the concept of tiny lights added in. Maybe I could add another texture layer where it would be further tiled to add "high-res" dots?

I really like the concept of tiny lights added in. Maybe I could add another texture layer where it would be further tiled to add "high-res" dots?

So that it's still a small texture, but gets a higher res effect? Maybe. Having the dots makes the place seem more populated, though you can only really make out the individual lights when you're quite low, so if you eventually have town buildings with emissive textures, you won't be missing much higher up.

But that may be more expensive in terms of memory use, when clever use of the dots could get a similar effect, at least when flying.

Not so good when you're on the ground.

First I reckon it's worth having another go with just the one texture, with bigger dots this time. Then if that doesn't do the trick an extra layer could well be the way to go.

A cool thing about this type of mod is the way you can stirp away bits you don't want, so making one shouldn't hurt.

I got a pretty cool pic of the IVA problem.

It doesn't happen after you reach a certain height. Something to do with the camera for rendering planets when you're near?
